title: Considering Equity in Data Visualization
text: Emily and I had the pleasure of presenting to the 2024 cohort of LDI Summer Undergraduate Mentored Research Program (SUMR). The materials for this interactive presentation were adapted from the Urban Institute‚Äôs series of Do No Harm guides, which focus on how to incorporate principles of equity into data collection, visualization, and communication. We concluded our talk by playing a game with the Scholars, encouraging them to use what they took away from the presentation to identify areas for improvement in a series of visualizations taken from published dashboards, papers, and other sources.

title: Meditaciones: Lo importante es comenzar
text:
Ten presente, pues, estas prescripciones y deja a un lado todo lo dem√°s. No olvides tampoco que la vida se limita para cada uno de nosotros al tiempo presente, que s√≥lo es un fugaz intervalo; el resto de la existencia no existe, o es incierto. Por consiguiente, la vida de todo ser no representa casi nada; el lugar donde transcurre no es m√°s que un rinc√≥n insignificante de la Tierra, y la reputaci√≥n m√°s duradera que uno deja tras de s√≠ apenas si vale algo, pues se transmite mediante una sucesi√≥n a individuos insignificantes que, a su vez deben morir tambi√©n, que no se conocen a ellos mismos y que, como es natural, conocen mucho menos todav√≠a al que muri√≥ hace mucho tiempo.

Meditaciones, Libro III - Paragrafro 6

Los grandes cambios en la vida comienzan con acciones concretas. Acciones de hecho peque√±as. Muy peque√±as, que casi son imperceptibles para nuestra conciencia tan agitada en un mundo que no tiene cabida para la reflexi√≥n en silencio. Y aun as√≠, estos cambios en silencio representan los gigantescos terremotos que hacen evolucionar las trayectorias de vida.
Para m√≠, este punto de inflexi√≥n se resume en escribir. Cerrar los ojos, mirarme al interior y poder deslizar mis dedos en un teclado donde intento no poner freno alguno a lo que estoy poniendo en la realidad. Se resume en sacar de la cabeza todas las lanas enredaderas que pueden hacer dentro de un cerebro que lidia por encontrar un prop√≥sito en la vida. Porque la vida es corta. Est√° hecha de esos segundos que llamamos el presente. Y que si no somos conscientes, se pasan sin ser admirados en su justo valor.
Escribir es aclarar y escuchar en los pensamientos. Y al momento de escribir esto, mis ojos lloran de poder exprimir lo que siento en esta √©poca de mi vida de Octubre 2024. Un periodo donde cambios peque√±os pueden tener una incidencia gigante en mi existencia y paso por esta tierra.
Este escrito no tiene m√°s prop√≥sito que poder comenzar con algo. Empezar con cosas insignificantes. El acto de empezar es como la semilla que se pone en un jard√≠n. Nunca seremos totalmente en control del resultado. Sin embargo, en honor al estoicismo, quiero hacer la acci√≥n que hace parte de mi control. Tiene el prop√≥sito de poder sacar afuera, valga la redundancia, las cosas que se llevan dentro. Tiene como objetivo aclarar un camino hacia donde apuntar. Ya que, durante el trayecto que tiene mi existencia he perdido el rumbo.
Lo llamo meditaciones en honor al Estoicismo, que aunque es una filosof√≠a que resuena en mi, siento qu√© es mas un camino de vida a seguir.



 Volver arribaReutilizaci√≥nCC BY-SA 4.0

title: Fabio A. Cruz Sanchez
text:
Hello there! üëã.
I work specifically at the Research team on innovation process -ERPI- Laboratory and teach at the National School in Industrial Systems Engineering and Innovation -ENSGSI School- at Nancy - France.
My research is developed at the Lorraine Fab Living Lab Plateform on projects related to the concept of Distributed recycling for circular economy perspectives valuing the partnership between open source tools, social innovation spaces, holistic indicators as a way to effect change in people‚Äôs.

title: Les fab labs : des lieux de partage pour booster l‚Äôinnovation
text:
R√©sum√©
Les entreprises, les universit√©s, les communes ont toutes pari√© sur le d√©veloppement des fab labs. Il s‚Äôagit pour elles de favoriser le d√©veloppement de projets d‚Äôinnovation par ces espaces d√©di√©s √† l‚Äôapprentissage et √† la collaboration. Cet article pr√©sente les diff√©rentes facettes des fab labs au moyen d‚Äôun questionnement syst√©matique. Apr√®s une rapide introduction, une analyse des typologies et des ressources disponibles dans les fab labs est donn√©e. Leur constitution en r√©seau et leurs modes de gouvernance sont discut√©s, puis l‚Äôarticle met en lumi√®re les acteurs de ces lieux et les projets qui y sont r√©alis√©s. Enfin, quelques perspectives du devenir de ces espaces sont propos√©es.

title: Multi-material distributed recycling via material extrusion: recycled high density polyethylene and poly (ethylene terephthalate) mixture
text: The high volume of plastic waste and the extremely low recycling rate have created a serious challenge worldwide. Local distributed recycling and additive manufacturing (DRAM) offers a solution by economically incentivizing local recycling. One DRAM technology capable of processing large quantities of plastic waste is fused granular fabrication, where solid shredded plastic waste can be reused directly as 3D printing feedstock. This study presents an experimental assessment of multimaterial recycling printability using two of the most common thermoplastics in the beverage industry, polyethylene terephthalate (PET) and high-density polyethylene (HDPE), and the feasibility of mixing PET and HDPE to be used as a feedstock material for large-scale 3-D printing. After the material collection, shredding, and cleaning, the characterization and optimization of parameters for 3D printing were performed. Results showed the feasibility of printing a large object from rPET/ rHDPE flakes, reducing production costs by up to 88%.

title: Multi-material distributed recycling via material extrusion: recycled high density polyethylene and poly (ethylene terephthalate) mixture
text: The high volume of plastic waste and the extremely low recycling rate have created a serious challenge worldwide. Local distributed recycling and additive manufacturing (DRAM) offers a solution by economically incentivizing local recycling. One DRAM technology capable of processing large quantities of plastic waste is fused granular fabrication, where solid shredded plastic waste can be reused directly as 3D printing feedstock. This study presents an experimental assessment of multimaterial recycling printability using two of the most common thermoplastics in the beverage industry, polyethylene terephthalate (PET) and high-density polyethylene (HDPE), and the feasibility of mixing PET and HDPE to be used as a feedstock material for large-scale 3-D printing. After the material collection, shredding, and cleaning, the characterization and optimization of parameters for 3D printing were performed. Results showed the feasibility of printing a large object from rPET/ rHDPE flakes, reducing production costs by up to 88%.

title: Enhancing vibration damping properties of additively manufactured viscoelastic structures through process parameter optimization
text: With the increasing use of additive manufacturing (AM) in diverse fields, printed structures are inevitably exposed to vibrations, which can result in fracture, fatigue, and noise. Present study aims to enhance the damping characteristics of the final part by incorporating viscoelastic materials into the primary structure using multi-material AM. The effects of process parameters on the vibration damping characteristics of printed viscoelastic structures were investigated through modal analysis and design of experiments. Results show that higher nozzle temperature, smaller layer height, lower deposition speed and smaller raster angle contribute to higher resonant frequencies and loss factors of the final parts.

title: Enhancing vibration damping properties of additively manufactured viscoelastic structures through process parameter optimization
text: With the increasing use of additive manufacturing (AM) in diverse fields, printed structures are inevitably exposed to vibrations, which can result in fracture, fatigue, and noise. Present study aims to enhance the damping characteristics of the final part by incorporating viscoelastic materials into the primary structure using multi-material AM. The effects of process parameters on the vibration damping characteristics of printed viscoelastic structures were investigated through modal analysis and design of experiments. Results show that higher nozzle temperature, smaller layer height, lower deposition speed and smaller raster angle contribute to higher resonant frequencies and loss factors of the final parts.

The objective of this work is to evaluate the performance of the FFF and FGF techniques in terms of technical and economical dimensions at the desktop 3D printing scale. Recycled and virgin polylactic acid material was studied by using five different types of recycling feedstocks: commercial filament, pellets, distributed filament, distributed pellets, and shredded waste. The results showed that the mechanical properties from the FGF technique using same configurations showed no statistical differences to FFF samples.

This article therefore explores the economic and environmental feasibility of this distributed plastic recycling approach from a logistics perspective, as a step towards its validation. To achieve this, an optimization mixed integer linear programming (MILP) model was used as an evaluation tool, representing a local closed loop supply chain (CLSC) network.

The contribution of the present study is twofold: first, a general methodology to evaluate the recyclability of thermoplastics used as feedstock in open-source 3D printing machines is proposed. Then, the proposed methodology is applied to the recycling study of polylactic acid (PLA) material addressed to the fused filament fabrication (FFF) technique, which is currently the most widely used.

title: Fabio A. Cruz Sanchez
text:
Hey, I‚Äôm happy you‚Äôre here

I work at the Universit√© de Lorraine in France in topics related to the mechanical and innovation engineering.
The objet of my research is the concept of distributed recycling process. The idea is to better understand the limits of this approach as a short/medium strategy of the plastic waste problem. I am very interested to work with fantastic people to make a holistic analysis of this topic, by doing research from technical, logistical and systemic evaluation.
Learn more about my research interests in publications.
Get in touch by sending me a note!

title: Philly Center City District SIPS: An Interactive Map
text:
Philly‚Äôs Center City District posted a list of restaurants and bars participating in Philly‚Äôs 2024 CCD SIPS. CCD SIPS is a series of summer Wednesday evenings (5-7pm) filled with happy hour specials, between June 5th and August 28th.
Information from the website was scarped in order to present the information as a map. You can click or tap on the circle map markers to see information about each restaurant/bar along with a direct link to their posted happy hour specials.
Check out the link at the top of this post for a larger version of the interactive map below, search the table below, or take a look at CCD SIPS maps from past years.
